column1: Merkel to present program to speed up deportation of failed asylum seekers ñ reports
column2: German Chancellor Angela Merkel is planning to present a new plan to accelerate the process of deporting failed asylum seekers, including special ‚Äúdeparture centers‚Äù and more financial aid for those deciding to leave voluntarily, German media reports

column1: Bad news for Proxima b: Red dwarf flares jeopardize ëhabitabilityí of planet (VIDEO)
column2: The habitability of planets orbiting young red dwarf stars is threatened by frequent stellar eruptions that likely deplete atmospheric oxygen levels, according to new NASA research.

column1: International Biathlon Union tells Russia to give up right to host 2021 World Championship
column2: The International Biathlon Union (IBU) has given Russia until February 24 to relinquish the right to host the IBU 2021 World Championship, planned for the Tyumen region.

column1: Post-Brexit Britain resumes Chinese charm offensive after relations falter
column2: UK Prime Minister Theresa May will visit China later this year in an effort to reestablish relations, which have somewhat faltered since ex-PM David Cameron and his Chancellor George Osborne courted the Chinese government in 2015.

column1: US senators trying to gain veto power that could block Trump from lifting sanctions on Russia
column2: A group of prominent US senators is leading a bipartisan effort to push through the so-called Russia Review Act, which would allow the Senate to veto any attempt of newcomer President Donald Trump to loosen sanctions on Moscow.

column1: S-400 air defense systems mobilized near Moscow in snap exercise

column1: 15,000 homeless after Philippines slum devastated by fire  (PHOTOS, VIDEOS)
column2: A massive blaze at an overcrowded slum in the Philippines capital of Manila, has left at least 15,000 people homeless.

column1: Large-scale German police op targets suspected Al-Nusra Front supporters
column2: German police targeted suspected Al-Nusra Front affiliates during large-scale raids across the federal state of North Rhine-Westphalia, looking for evidence of aiding Islamist militants in Syria, according to the Federal Prosecutors‚Äô Office.
